author: Mark Sandritter
title: Scott Brooks’ daughter said he looked ‘chunky’ in black jeans so he didn’t join the Wizards wearing all black
text:
In anticipation for their game against the Celtics on Tuesday night, the Wizards decided to all wear all black. 
“We’re wearing all black to the game,” said Wizards forward Kelly Oubre, via the Washington Post . “It’s a memo that the team’s giving out. We’re ready for whatever. Round 3. Let’s get it.”
It’s the latest occurrence in what has become an odd rivalry . For some players, the all black look was an easy one to pull off.
Otto Porter going Men in Black pic.twitter.com/BIvZGGPnUz 
— Hoop District (@HoopDistrictDC) January 24, 2017 For head coach Scott Brooks, it appears finding the right the all-black wardrobe was a bit more of a challenge.
Scott Brooks says his daughter told him not to wear his black jeans to the game because "you look a little chunky in them."
— David Aldridge (@daldridgetnt) January 24, 2017 At least Brooks’ daughter kept it real with him. Everyone in the NBA pays attention to the walk into the arena with cameras recording and flashbulbs popping. You can’t show up looking chunky.
To avoid the chunky look, Brooks opted for some blue jeans, bucking the all black movement.
Scott Brooks will wear blue jeans tonight, but, he declares, "I had black knee sleeves on at my pickup game today."
— Jay King (@ByJayKing) January 24, 2017
